ygData.subject: Re: Cost of gaining skill points
ygData.msgSnippet: I started smithing with 10 skill points.  I have lost 115PP 9GP, 6SP, 9CP in smithing so far (or spent this much to achieve level 84, depending on how you look
ygData.messageBody:
I started smithing with 10 skill points. I have lost 115PP 9GP, 6SP, 9CP in smithing so far (or spent this much to achieve level 84, depending on how you look at it). This is after I've sold my finished products. My average "loss" per level, from 10 to 84, was: 1PP, 5GP, 6SP, 7CP.

I've spent countless hours standing at a forge. I didn't put a price on that, nor the 2 books I've purchased or the 10 skill points I wasted in the beginning to get this started. With the market flooded with cheap banded, and now bronze becoming the armor of choice, I feel that I've gone as far as I should in this endeavor.

Following is the breakdown of how much I spent per item. The numbers are almost exact, if not exact. I was careful to write down my successes and failures. If they're off, it's probably only by a fraction, unless I miss-typed a number into my calculator.

I've listed prices as 4 digits, first is PP (may be multiple digits), then GP, SP, and CP (all single digits).
Ex: 0,0,1,3 = Cost to buy water.

Skill level 10 through 20 making metal bits
Attempts: 62
Made: 31
Failed: 31
Cost per attempt: 0,0,7,6
Total cost: 4,7,1,2
Average cost per level (10-20): 0,4,2,8
(NOTE: Selling metal bits for a loss would lower the cost here, but metal bits are needed in bulk for the next 100 or so levels.)

Skill level 21-40 making scalers
Bits attempted: 164
Bits made: 128
Bits failed: 36
Scalers attempted: 136
Scalers made: 72
Scalers failed: 64
Total cost: 22,8,0,0
Sell LCL Molds for: 0,1,3,6
Total after selling the LCL Molds: 13,0,0,8
Cost per level (21-40): 6,5,0,4
(NOTE: Scaler molds made "Large Container Lid Mold" when I was at this level. They didn't make the files until I passed this item (it became trivial)).

Skill Level 41-50 making skewers (didn't know about lanterns yet)
Bits attempted: 225
Bits made: 206
Bits failed: 19
Skewers attempted: 184
Skewers made: 22
Skewers failed: 162
Total Cost: 37,8,9,2
Sell skewers for: 0,1,6,0
Total after selling skewers: 34,3,7,2
Cost per level (41-50): 3,4,3,7

** Skill level 50
Attempted to make 3 gorgets. Cost per attempt: 1,2,8,8. All three failed.
Total cost during level 50 taking the average and adding the gorget attempts:
(3,4,3,7 + 3,8,6,4 = 7,3,0,1)

Skill Level 51-67 making lanterns
Bits attempted: 160
Bits made: 157
Bits failed: 3
Lanterns attempted: 232
Lanterns made: 126
Lanterns failed: 106
Total Cost: 58,5,6,0
Sell lanterns for: 0,2,0,0
Total after selling lanterns: 33,3,6,0
Cost per level (51-67): 1,9,6,2

Skill Level 68-84 making skewers (current level)
Bits attempted: 240
Bits made: 227
Bits failed: 13
Skewers attempted: 229
Skewers made: 85
Skewers failed: 144
Total Cost: 44,1,1,7
Sell skewers for: 0,1,6,0
Total after selling skewers: 30,5,1,7
Cost per level (68-84): 1,7,9,5

** Skill level 68
Attempted to make 2 gorgets. Cost per attempt: 1,2,8,8. Both failed.
Total cost during level 68 taking the average and adding the gorget attempts:
(1,7,9,5 + 2,5,7,6 = 4,3,7,1)




----- Original Message -----
From: <fkrueger@...>
To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, June 16, 1999 11:35 AM
Subject: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Cost of gaining skill points


> From: fkrueger@...
>
> I have a smithing question that might first look
>
> like a fletching questions, but please bear with
>
> me.
>
>
>
> To develop my fletching skill I make arrows - bows
>
> are much too expensive for a failure. Before the
>
> recent change to the skills I would buy a batch
>
> of raw materials from the fletching supplier and
>
> tediously make arrows, frequently getting a
>
> message that my skill had gone up. I sold the
>
> completed arrows back to a merchant in my guild
>
> to minimize the cost of gaining skill. (The
>
> market for arrows isn't so hot.) In my most
>
> recent training exercise I went from a skill of
>
> 69 to a skill of 74. The outlay, after buying
>
> raw materials and selling the completed arrows,
>
> was about 2.5 pp, or about 5g/skill point. All
>
> this was before the patch. Note that this cost
>
> is very different than using the skill points
>
> you get when you gain levels, I'm not talking
>
> about that.
>
>
>
> Fletchers complained bitterly about having to
>
> make single arrows. Verant responded with a
>
> solution that sells components in batches of
>
> five and produces arrows in batches of five.
>
> The problem is, the skill level is based on the
>
> number of times the fletcher hits the "combine"
>
> key. The tediousness of making arrows has been
>
> fixed, but the price of gaining skill points has
>
> been multiplied by a factor of five.
>
>
>
> My question to you smiths is, do you know how
>
> much it costs to increase your skill? In the
>
> range from 60 to 80 is it 5g/point, or
>
> 2.5pp/point? Or is it far different than that?
>
> I appreciate your patience in reading through
>
> this. Thank you.
>
>
>
> Ramalama - 12.95 Level Wood-Elf Ranger on Mithanial Marr
